explanation: The Term of this Agreement shall be for a period of [* ****] years and [*****] months commencing the 1st day of September 2004 and terminating the [*****] day of [*****]. - The redacted portions of the start and end date makes it impossible to determine the duration of the agreement, leading to uncertainty about the obligations of both parties.

section:
C."MANDATORY PRODUCTS" shall mean the following ADAMS GOLF PRODUCTS that CONSULTANT must exclusively play/use in all Champions/Senior Professional Golf Association (SPGA) and Professional Golf Association (PGA) events at all times:
[***** ]
explanation: Section 2.C defines 'MANDATORY PRODUCTS', but it's impossible to know which specific products fall under that definition because it is redacted. Therefore, it's impossible to know what the consultant is obligated to use, impacting Section 5 (Exclusive Use of Product).

section: Notwithstanding paragraphs 4A, 4B and 4C above, CONSULTANT shall be entitled to endorse and play the [*****].
explanation: Section 4.D allows the consultant to endorse/play a product that would otherwise be prohibited, but the product itself is redacted. This makes it impossible to understand the scope of this exception and could lead to disputes. It creates ambiguity.

During the term of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall exclusively play/use the MANDATORY PRODUCT whenever practical. The decision on whether to use the MANDATORY PRODUCT in a specific tournament will be at the sole discretion of the CONSULTANT based on performance considerations. (It is expressly understood by the parties that CONSULTANT may play [* ****] clubs in the bag other than ADAMS GOLF clubs including, but not limited to, a putter by a manufacturer other than ADAMS GOLF but may not endorse those clubs and/or putter.) - Section 5 mandates exclusive use of Adams Golf's Mandatory Products, but immediately provides an exception for other clubs and putters. The condition to use MANDATORY PRODUCT whenever practical combined with the sole discretion based on performance considerations is contradictory. Additionally, since mandatory products is redacted, it's impossible to enforce the rule.

section: 8. MINIMUM NUMBER OF TOURNAMENTS AND POTENTIAL REPAYMENT OF BASE COMPENSATION
explanation:
In each and every calendar year of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall achieve a satisfactory record of play in a minimum of [* ****] professional golf association events on the SPGA and/or PGA tour (which shall include both the PGA and SPGA Tour Skins Games). If for any reason, CONSULTANT should achieve a satisfactory record of play in less than [*****] SPGA and/or PGA tour events in a calendar year, he shall repay ADAMS GOLF an amount per event for each event under [*****] achieved in the given calendar year as follows:
The agreed upon repayment amount per event per calendar year: 1. Year 1. $[*****] ...- Section 8 outlines a minimum number of tournaments the consultant must play and a repayment schedule if he doesn't. Because the number of tournaments and repayment amount are redacted, the entire clause is rendered unenforceable. It is incomplete.

CONSULTANT will use his best efforts to make reference to the ADAMS GOLF PRODUCT and wear [*****] and display ADAMS GOLF'S brand name. - Section 11 states that the consultant will wear something with the Adams Golf brand name, but that piece of clothing is redacted, resulting in an unenforceable statement.

For the entire term of this Agreement, from September 1, 2004 through [*****] ADAMS GOLF shall pay CONSULTANT a base compensation of [*****] dollars. The base compensation shall be paid [*****]. - The redacted end date and compensation amount make it impossible to determine the total compensation, which is critical to the agreement's enforceability.

section:
A. In addition to his base compensation, CONSULTANT shall also be entitled to bonuses based on performance in particular PGA and SPGA events and year-end standing as follows:
 3. If CONSULTANT finishes in the top [*****] on the official year end money list of the Champion's Tour (SPGA), CONSULTANT shall also be entitled to a year end performance bonus according to the following schedule:
a.2005 $ [*****]
b.2006$ [*****]
c.2007$ [*****]
d.2008$ [*****]
e.2009$ [*****]
explanation: Section 19.A.3 describes a year-end performance bonus based on ranking on a money list, but the ranking and the bonus amount is redacted, creating an unenforceable clause because the amounts are not included.

section:
A.In the event of termination of this Agreement, ADAMS GOLF shall cease using the name and/or likeness of CONSULTANT in advertising within [*****] days.
B.In the event of termination of this Agreement, ADAMS GOLF shall cease using the name and/or likeness of CONSULTANT on Product within [*****] months after termination of this Agreement.
explanation: Sections 24.A and 24.B relate to Adams Golf's rights upon termination, but the timeframe is redacted, creating ambiguity about how long Adams Golf has to stop using the consultant's name/likeness.
